title: Shop Shuffle
description:
Shuffles the contents of Weapon, Armor, and Item shops, changing what shops have what items for sale.
Pure and Soft potions will always be available in the Coneria Item Shop.

title: Random Weapons and Armor
description: Adds various low to mid-tier Weapons and Armor found in the game to Weapon and Armor Shops, regardless of whether they are normally sold in shops or found in chests.

title: Include Caster and Elite Gear
description:
Adds rare and high level Weapons and Armor found in the game to Weapon and Armor Shops.
These can include normally unique or high-value items such as the Masmune and Ribbons as well as equipment that casts spells when used.

title: Item Magic Shuffle
description:
This flag shuffles what spell is cast when using any of the castable items (Power Gauntlet, Bane Sword, ect.).
The spell name will replace the name of the item for clarity, although icons will remain the same (or absent for Defense).
Items that use the same icon cannot be differentiated except by equipping.

title: Extended Open Progression
description: Remove the river tile between the Dwarf Cave and Northwest Castle so it can be traversed on foot.

title: Northern Docks
description: Add additional docks near Onrac and the Mirage Tower.

title: Ryukahn Desert Dock
description: Add an additional dock near the Ryukhan desert.

title: Magic Levels
description:
Shuffles the levels of spells, but not what level is sold at each magic shop.
Unless "Keep Permissions" is checked, the ability of a character to learn a given spell depends on whether or not a class can learn the spell originally in that spell's new slot.

title: Magic Shop Shuffle
description:
Magic Shop Shuffle: Shuffles what level spells are available at each shop.
With this checked, you will likely find several different levels of magic at each shop, regardless of location.

title: Magic Shop Location Shuffle
description: Shuffles the locations of magic shops except Coneria (Level 1), so that Pravoka's magic shop can be in Melmond, etc.

title: Keep Permissions
description: Forces spells to keep the class permissions from the unrandomized game, no matter what slot they are in or level they are.

title: SpoilerCheckBox
description:
Generates a text file of where items have been shuffled to which is provided when creating the randomized ROM.
NOTE: This box will affect the seed generated.

title: Remember ROM
description: Allows the website to remember the file location of the ROM you use.

title: Tournament Safe ROM
description: Verifies that the ROM provided is an original Final Fantasy 1 ROM.

title: RNG Table
description: Shuffles the RNG Table and the Battle RNG, changing encounters and the distance between encounters while leaving overall probabilites unchanged.

title: Fix Missing Battle RNG Entry
description: The vanilla Battle RNG table has two 00s out of 256 hex values. If checked, this flag replaces one of them with 0x95, the missing hex value.

title: Enemy Scripts
description: Shuffles the spells and skills (if any) each monster uses, allowing any enemy to have any other's combat logic.

title: Unsafe Pirates
description: Allows Pirates to be shuffled skills and spells. Left unchecked, Pirates will always have a script that directs them to only attack.

title: Allow Unsafe Start Area
description:
Entrance shuffle normally requires at least 3 safe locations amongst the Coneria Castle, Dwarf Cave, Temple of Fiends, Matoya's Cave, and Pravoka entrances.
This flag removes that safety net.

title: Hints from villagers
description:
In each town a villager reveals the location of an item.
The old men in Coneria, Pravoka, Melmond and Onrac.
An Elf scholar in Elfland, Lukkanh in Crescent Lake.
The Witch in Gaia.
The Lefein villager on the left side (no Slab required).

title: Hints from dungeon explorers
description:
Five NPC in dungeons reveals the location of an item.
Down the dead end of Marsh Cave B1.
On Lich's floor in Earth Cave.
In the hallway of Gurgu Volcano B3.
In a room on the left of Sea Shrine B4.
In the South room of Sky Palace 3F.

title: Useless Hints
description: Half of the NPCs give useless hints.

title: Shuffled location in dungeon
description: The NPCs could be at two other possible locations in each dungeon.

title: Party Draft
description:
Draft your party from a pool of random characters.
Allowed classes are selected from Party Composition, allowing duplicates.
Once a character is selected, it's removed from the pool. Cancelling your choice puts back the character in the pool.

title: Pool Size
description: Number of characters in the pool.

title: Include Promoted Classes
description: Allow promoted classes to be added to the pool.

title: Random Promotions
description: When giving the TAIL to Bahamut, promote your party to random classes.

title: Include Base Classes
description: Allow base classes as possible promotions.

title: Spoil Promotions
description:
Change class names to show class promotions.
Format: Current class - Promotion class.

title: Linear MP Growth
description:
Change MP growth for Red, White and Black Mages to a linear growth:
1 MP every 3 levels for each slots starting from the original level for a given slot (ie: first lv3 MP for a White Mage at level 5, etc.).
Mainly a fix for Random Promotions.

title: Blursed Classes
description: Give bonuses and maluses at random to each class. Press Select at Party selection screen and A at Status screen to reveal the modifiers.

title: Chaos Mode
description: Shuffle Stats, Spellcasting and Equipment permissions between all classes.

title: Enemy Skills/Spells
description:
Shuffles enemy skills and spells so they can appear in any script. There are three groups of enemies:
All random encounters,
the first fiend fights,
and the second fiend fights with WarMech.

title: Only Shuffle Boss Scripts
description:
Only include the scripts of the Fiends when shuffling scripts.  Normal enemies will retain their original scripts.
This alone does not mean however that spells on those scripts cannot be shuffled.

title: Only Shuffle Boss Spells and Skills
description:
Only include the spells and skills of the Fiends when shuffling spells.  Normal enemies will retain their original spells and skills.
This alone does not mean however that scripts cannot be shuffled.

title: Enemy Status Attacks
description: Shuffles the status ailments each enemy can inflict when they use physical attacks.

title: Random Enemy Status Attacks
description: The status ailments enemies inflict on melee attack are randomly determined, and can include multiple death attacks or silencing attacks.

title: Enemy Unrunnable Formations
description: Shuffles what formations are and are not runnable. Bosses and some other encounters will remain unrunnable.

title: All Encounters are Unrunnable
description: All Encounters are Unrunnable: Disables the ability to run from fights.

title: First Strike and Surprise Possible when Unrunnable
description: Allows you to first strike an unrunnable formation. Also allows an unrunnable formation to ambush YOU.

title: Enemy Surprise Bonus
description: Enemy Surprise Bonus: Shuffles the surprise bonus for enemy formations, changing which groups will almost always ambush you.

title: Enemy Formation Shuffle Mode
description:
Shuffles the encounters that appear in enemy domains.
Vanilla: Enemy groups remain as they exist in the original game.  This allows players to predict encounters in a dungeon if they know the vanilla values.
Shuffle Rarity: Enemy groups are shuffle within a zone, so that Group 1 fights can appear as Group 6, etc.  This removes the ability to 'scout' the encounter table and know which fights will appear without having to re-learn the process for each new dungeon.
Shuffle Across Zones: Shuffles the domains so that Ice Cave groups can appear in Gurgu Volcano etc., but does not alter the contents of the domains themselves
Totally Random: Draws at random and without a shuffle any formation excepting fiends, plot-triggered encounters, and empty encounters.  The encounters can appear in any zone except the starting zones.
This feature is disabled when generating new enemy formations (Enemizer).

title: Enemy Forced Encounter Tiles
description: Shuffles trap tiles excepting Fiend Refights.

title: Use Random Formations
description: Adds several formations into the shuffle pool for trap tiles, including formations that are not available in the original game.

title: WarMECH Mode
description:
Vanilla: WarMECH may appear as a group 7 encounter on Sky Castle 5F, as in the original game.
Patrolling: A WarMECH sprite will appear wandering on Sky Castle 4F.  Talking to WarMECH starts an unrunnable battle.
Required: A WarMECH sprite will guard Tiamat's room.  You must defeat it before you can fight Tiamat.
Unleashed: WarMECH appears as a Group 7 formation in all zones.

title: Treasures
description: Shuffle all treasures normally available to a random chest in the game. All items are assured to be in a chest somewhere in the game.

title: Randomize Treasures
description:
Randomizes the contents of each chest based on tier of item. Each setting for random wealth weighs the pool differently.
Items not normally found in chests may be available, some items may not be found in chests that normally would, and duplicates may exist.

title: Random Wealth
description:
Alters the distribution of items:
Normal is the same number of each tier of item as in the vanilla item pool.
High removes gold chests for more legendary and rare equipment, while more common items shows up in lower and lower tiers.
Melmond has the lowest chance of top tier gear.

title: Better Trap Treasure
description: Adjusts treasure chests that require walking over an encounter tile so that they are more likely to have high-tier treasures. There is a list in the Help section.

title: Main NPC Items
description: Adds the Bridge, Lute, Ship, Rod, Canoe, Cube, and Bottle to the shuffle.

title: Fetch Quest Rewards
description: Randomizes the rewards from the fetch quest items. These are the Crown, Crystal, Herb, TNT, Adamant, Bottle, and the Lefein item from the Slab. If unchecked, each fetch quest is vanilla.

title: Objective NPCs
description: Shuffles the locations of Dr. Unne, the Elven Doctor, and Bahamut. Note that the Prince is still napping in Elfland once you deliver the Herb to the Elven Doctor and that the small pool means NPCs may retain their normal location.

title: Free Ship
description: Bikke's SHIP will appear in Coneria's dock at the start of the game.

title: Free Airship
description: The AIRSHIP rises from the grassy plains in front of Coneria at the start of the game.

title: Free Bridge
description: The BRIDGE linking Coneria to Pravoka and onward is built when the game begins.

title: Free Canal
description: Nerrick's CANAL is already built when the game begins.

title: Free Tail
description: The rat's TAIL required for promotion is in your inventory when the game begins.'

title: Random Weapon Bonus
description:
Gives each weapon a random bonus from the selected range. This will increase or decrease (if negative) its damage by 2 per bonus, hit by 3(max 50%) per bonus, crit by 3(1.5%) per bonus.
All values cannot go below zero hit or 1 crit/damage.

title: Random Weapon Bonus - Exclude Masa
description: Masmune will not receive any bonuses or minuses, it will always be regular.

title: Random Armor Bonus
description: Gives each armor a random bonus from the selected range. This will increase or decrease (if negative) its absorb by 1 per bonus (2 for body armor) and reduce its weight penalty by 1 per bonus (2 for body armor).

title: Separate Boss HP Scaling
description: Uses a second scaling for boss hp independant of other stats.

title: Separate Enemy HP Scaling
description: Uses a second scaling for enemy hp independant of other stats.

title: Free NPCs
description: Guarantees all "Main Quest" NPCs will hold an item from your incentive item pool. These NPCs include: the king, Princess Sara, Bikke, Sage Lukhan, Sarda and the Waterfall Cave Robot.

title: Fetch Quest NPCs
description: Guarantees all "Fetch Quest" NPCs will hold an item from your incentive pool. Fetch quest NPCs require their respective key items to gain the item they hold. For example, Astos requires the CROWN in order to get his item. Fetch quest NPCs include: Astos, Matoya, Elf Prince, the Dwarves, the Lefeinish, and the Fairy.

title: Ice Cave Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the FLOATER chest from the vanilla game.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Castle Ordeals Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the TAIL chest from the vanilla game.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Marsh Cave Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the CROWN chest from the vanilla game.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Titan’s Trove Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the leftmost chest in Titan’s Trove. Note that if the Titan’s Trove map edit is on, this chest will require the RUBY to access.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Earth Cave Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the RUBY chest in the vanilla game. The Vampire must be killed to obtain access to this chest.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Volcano Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the leftmost chest on KARY’s floor. This chest requires two trap tile encounters to access, so make sure you are prepared before approaching.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Sea Shrine Incentive Chest
description: Incentivizes the SLAB chest from the vanilla game. One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Sky Palace Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the ADAMANT chest from the vanilla game.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Coneria Castle Incentive Chest
description: Incentivizes the TNT chest from the vanilla game. This chest requires the KEY to access. One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Marsh KEY Locked Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the bottom right chest of the final floor of Marsh Cave. This chest requires the KEY to access.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Chaos Rush
description:
Enables Chaos Rush mode, allowing you to reach Chaos without needing the KEY to pass through the door in Temple of Fiends and adding the LUTE to your inventory at the start of the game.
This setting does not automatically light the four Orbs, although other settings may change this behavior.

title: Free Orbs
description: Starts the game with all four Orbs lit. The KEY and LUTE are still required to reach Chaos, although other settings may change this behavior.

title: Alternate Final Boss
description:
Changes the Chaos fight to involve one of several enemy formations instead of just Chaos.
These formations are: Kary2 and Tiamat2; 2 Lich2s and 4 Phantoms; 2 Warmechs and 6 Evilmen; or Chaos and 8 Garlands.

title: Shorten ToFR
description:
Shortens the Temple of Fiends Revisted to lead straight to Chaos' Floor. The four Orbs are still required to enter the dungeon, excepting the use of other settings.
Neither the KEY nor the LUTE will be requires if this box is checked.

title: Include Fiend Tiles
description: Adds the four Fiend refights to the Chaos floor. Two trap tiles will be found on either side south of the entrance, with the boss in each tile randomized for each seed.

title: Fun Enemy names
description: Changes enemy names in the generated seed. Most of the name changes in this setting are the result of various community memes over the years and may not make sense to newer players.

title: Palette Swap
description:
Randomizes the colors of used for enemies in the generated seed. For example, Imps may be largely pink rather than orange.
Note that combining this setting with Fun Enemy Name can lead to confusion for newer players in both asking for and recieving advice.

title: Modern Battlefield
description: Changes the appearance of the battle screen, removing most of the bounding boxes so that it more closely resembles the battle screens seen in later installments in the series.

title: Team Steak
description:
Modifies the Tyro/T-Rex sprite to reflect the age old rivalry between two teams.
Team Tyro believes firmly in the sanctity of Tyro life while Team Steak believes in the sanctity of Tyro meat dinners. Choosing Team Steak will make it clear what you see when confronting these majestic-but-delicious creatures.

title: Music Shuffle
description:
Adjusts the behavior of background music during play.
No Music Shuffle leaves all tracks in their normal place.
Standard Music Shuffle shuffles only dungeon tracks along with the overworld theme.
Nonsensical music shuffle mixes every song in the game into one pool, including shorter tunes that can loop very quickly.
Disable music mutes all music, although sound effects will still play.

title: Disable Damage Tile Flicker
description: Disables screen flashing when stepping over lava tiles.

title: Disable Spell Cast Flash
description: Removes the full screen color flash when casting spells.

title: Menu Color
description:
Changes your menu screen color from the default blue to a selection of other colors.
This may also be changed in game by pressing Select at the New Game/Continue screen

title: Three Battle Palettes
description:
Changes the behavior of in-battle color palettes to allow spite edits to use three different palettes instead of the normal two.
This is an advanced option that requires the use of external tools such as FFHackster in order to have a noticeable effect.

title: Generate Spoiler Log!
description: Creates a spoiler log for the seed into the console window of the browser. The resulting ROM's randomization will be different than if the log had not been generated, in order to prevent cheating in races.

title: Main Progression Items
description: Adds the LUTE, KEY, ROD, OXYALE, CHIME and CUBE to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations..

title: Other Quest Items
description: Adds the CROWN, CRYSTAL, HERB, TNT, RUBY, BOTTLE, SLAB, and ADAMANT to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations..

title: Floater
description: Adds the FLOATER to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Canoe
description: Adds the CANOE to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Ship & Canal
description: Adds the SHIP and CANAL to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Tail
description: Adds the TAIL to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Masamune
description: Adds the Masamune to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Vorpal
description: Adds the Vorpal Sword to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Defense
description: Adds the Defense Sword to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Thor Hammer
description: Adds Thor's Hammer to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Opal Bracelet
description: Adds the Opal Bracelet to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Power Gauntlet
description: Adds the Power Gauntlet to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: White Shirt
description: Adds the White Shirt to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Black Shirt
description: Adds the Black Shirt to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Ribbon
description: Adds ONE Ribbon to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Shard Hunt
description:
Activates Shard Hunt, a mode in which the Light Warriors must acquire a number of a particular, special item in order to open the time gate in Temple of Fiends.
Defeating Fiends and activating the altars for the four standard orbs will instead grant the player 2 shards for Lich and Kary or 4 shards for Kraken and Tiamat.  The SHARDs replace generally low-quality items in the treasure pool.

title: Shard Goal
description: The number of SHARDs to collect in order to restore the Black Orb and travel into the past.

title: Entrance Shuffle
description:
Overworld entrances, except for towns, are shuffled, so that the entrance to Earth Cave may be at Waterfall, Volcano at the Cardia Islands, etc.
Required for floor shuffle.
Requires NPC Shuffle.

title: Include Dead Ends
description: Whether or not to include the empty floors of the Cardia Islands while shuffling. If they are not included, their entrances will be unchanged from the vanilla game.

title: Shuffle Floors
description:
Whether floors should also be shuffled. If floors are not shuffled, each area will be moved together, such that Earth B1 leads to Earth B2, etc...
If floors are shuffled, Earth B1 may lead to Volcano B3, for example.

title: Deep ToFR
description: Whether the Temple of Fiends floor must be at ground level (entered from the world map) or if it may be shuffled deeper, so that multiple floors may have to be crossed to enter it, and the Temple of Fiends Revisited (in the past).

title: Shuffle Towns
description: Whether to shuffle town entrances. When town entrances are shuffled, all towns, aside from Corneria, could appear at any other town, such that the town at Pravoka could be Lefein or vice-versa.

title: Mix All Entrances Together
description: Whether to mix dungeon and town entrances. When enabled, the entrance to any location, aside from Corneria Town, could lead to any town or dungeon.

title: Deep Towns
description: Whether to allow towns to be shuffled below dungeon floors. When enabled, towns other than Corneria may be hidden behind dungeon floors, such that Earth B1's staircase may lead to Elfland.

title: Sky Castle 4F
description:
The configuration of the teleporters in Sky Castle's 4th Floor.
Normal is vanilla teleporters.
Teleporters moves the location of the teleporters so that they must be found.
Maze introduces walls so the party must find a way through to the other teleporter.

title: Castle Ordeals Pillars
description: Whether to shuffle the destination of the teleport pillars on the second floor of the Castle of Ordeals.

title: Titan's Trove
description: Moves the Titan over a square such that even with the AIRSHIP it is not possible to reach the Titan's treausre boxes without feeding him the RUBY.

title: Zozo Melmond
description: Includes random battles on the desert tiles inside the town of Melmond, reminiscent of the town of Zozo in Final Fantasy VI.

title: Lefeinish Hospitality
description: Includes an Inn and Clinic (or Pub, if Tavern mode is enabled) in Lefein.

title: Confused Old Men
description: The circle of sages in Cresent Lake is no longer a circle, but each of the sages will walk around.

title: Early Open Progression
description: Changes the map to allow walking from Corneria to Dwarf Cave, as well as connecting the Ice Cave and Volcano river systems, to allow passage from Pravoka to Crescent Lake with the CANOE.

title: Early King Item
description: The King of Coneria will give the party his item before the Princess is saved.

title: Early Sarda Item
description: Sarda will give the party his item before the Vampire is killed.

title: Early Sage Item
description: The Sage in Cresent Lake will give his item without requiring the Earth Orb to be lit.

title: Early Ordeals
description: The party may complete the Castle of Ordeals without the CROWN.

title: Price Scaling
description:
Sets the scale of the prices of shop items and the value of gold treasure boxes you find.
Unclamped prices have a mean of 100% of normal prices (accounting for XP/Gold scale, so with 4x XP baseline prices and gold treasures will be 25% their normal values).  Clamped prices have a mean halfway between 100% and the maximum for the selected multiplier.

title: Monster Stats Scaling
description:
Sets the scale of monster stats (except Magic Defense).
Not all stats are adjusted equally, for example attack strength variance in either direction is only 1/4th that of HP variance.  Unclamped stats have a mean of 100% of normal stats.  Clamped stats have a mean halfway between 100% and the maximum for the selected multiplier (times adjustment factor for particular stats, like strength).

title: Boss Stats Scaling
description:
Sets the scale of boss monster stats (except Magic Defense).
Not all stats are adjusted equally, for example attack strength variance in either direction is only 1/4th that of HP variance.  Unclamped stats have a mean of 100% of normal stats.  Clamped stats have a mean halfway between 100% and the maximum for the selected multiplier (times adjustment factor for particular stats, like strength).

title: Exp/Gold Progressive Scaling
description: Increases the bonus provided by Exp/Gold boost based on the number of Key Items collected.

title: Wrap Overflowing Prices
description:
Whether items that cost more than 65,535G cost that (maximum) amount of G, or if the price should be wrapped around.
For example, when disabled, an item that should cost 67,000G would cost 65,535G. When enabled, that item would cost 1,465G.

title: Wrap Overflowing Scaled Stats
description: Whether stats that roll the maxium value should remain there or wrap back to 1. When disabled, a stat which was scaled to 260 would be 255. When enabled, the stat would be 5.

title: Scaled Stats Includes Morale
description: Whether enemy morale should also be scaled along with their other stats.

title: Static EXP Distribution
description: When enabled, all experience received by enemies is always distributed as if there were 4 Light Warriors, rather than dividing the total EXP between those Light Warriors alive at the end of battle.

title: Scale Starting Gold
description: Whether starting gold should be scaled according to the Exp/Gold scaling.

title: Easy Mode
description: Used primarily to test new features, this scales all enemy HP to 10% and sets the encounter rate on the overworld and dungeons to 0.2x.

title: Tavern Recruitment Mode
description: Replaces Clinics with Pubs. Pubs allow the party to recruit a Light Warrior of a random class, in addition to reviving fallen Light Warriors.

title: Disable Reviving at Taverns
description:
Disables the ability to revive Light Warriors at the Pub.
When enabled, fallen Light Warriors may only be revived with the LIFE or LIF2 spells, or replaced by the class sold by the Pub.

title: Only Replace Nones at Taverns
description: Limit hiring to only replace None characters, this means once you chose a party member for that spot, you are stuck with them.

title: No Party Shuffle Convenience
description: If enabled, the player's party is not automatically rearranged when afflicted with status ailments or slain.

title: Speed Hacks Convenience
description: If enabled, many game processes, such as opening the menu and battles, are significantly faster.

title: Identify Treasures Convenience
description: If enabled, the player can see what item is in a chest if their inventory is full, instead of seeing 'Can't Hold anymore'.

title: Dash Convenience
description: If enabled, the player's movement speed on foot is doubled.  Hold B while walking to reduce to normal speed.

title: Buy Quantity Convenience
description:
If enabled, the player has the option to select the quantity of items bought in the item shop.
Press left to reduce quantity by 1, right to increase quantity by 1, up to increase quantity by 10, and down to decrease quantity by 10.  Mutually exclusive with Buy Ten.

title: Buy Ten Convenience
description: If enabled, the player has the option to buy 10 of an item at once in the item shop, so they do not need to spend a long time buying 99 heal potions.

title: WAIT When Unrunnable Convenience
description: If enabled, the player is notified when it is impossible to escape a battle by RUNning, replacing the RUN command with WAIT.

title: Crit Number Display Convenience
description: If enabled, critical hits note how many hits out of the maximum connected with a critical, for example 2 critical hits out of 3, instead of simply marking that there was a critical.

title: Battle Magic Menu Wrap Around
description: If enabled, allows to wrap up and down in the battle magic menu.

title: Inventory Autosort
description: If enabled, HEAL, PURE, and SOFT potions are automatically moved to the first row of the item menu, followed by saving items on the second row, then all key items in your inventory.

title: Renounce Autosort
description: Forgo the Autosort Inventory feature if it's enabled.

title: House MP Restoration
description: Fixes a bug where the party's MP was restored only after the game was saved.

title: Weapon Stats
description: Fixes applying elemental and type bonuses to weapons

title: Halve BB Crit Rate
description: Halves the BB's unarmed crit rate.  (Normal behavior is critrate = Level * 2, with this it is merely critrate = Level).

title: Double Weapon Crit Rates
description: Doubles the crit rate of all weapons

title: Weapon Attack Bonuses
description: Increases elemental and type bonuses to weapons

title: Chance to Run
description: Fixes a bug in the way the chance to run is calculated.

title: Spell Fixes
description: Fixes bugs in various spells, such as TMPR, SABR, and HEL2. Also provides the opportunity to cancel out of casting WARP or EXIT.

title: Enemy Status Attacks
description:
Fixes a bug where enemies had a chance to apply a status ailment on attacks that missed once the first attack connected.
When enabled, only enemy hits that connect have a chance to inflict status effects.

title: Bl. Belt & Master Absorb Calculation
description:
Fixes a bug in the way Bl. Belt & Master absorb is calculated.
Unchecked, absorb is set to the Light Warrior's level so long as the character does not have a weapon equiped.
Enabled, the absorb is applied only when the Light Warrior does not have any armor equiped.

title: Enemy Elemental Resistances
description: Fixes a bug where XFER and other spells that affect elemental resistances would not work for enemies.

title: Enemy Spells Targeting Allies
description:
Fixes a bug in the way spells are applied when an enemy casts it on all allies.
Unchecked, spells, such as INV2, will skip the enemy that casted it.
Checked, the spell will (correctly) affect all enemies.

title: Improve Turn Order Randomization
description: Improves the balance of turn randomization. Unchecked, the turn order is weighted in favor of the enemies. Enabled, turn order is more balanced.

title: Fix Hit % Cap
description: Changes the max Hit % from 200 to 255.

title: House Full HP Restoration
description: Houses completely restore the party's HP. Unchecked, using a HOUSE restores 120HP to each Light Warrior.

title: LOCK and LOK2 Always Hit
description: When enabled, the spells LOCK and LOK2 will always be effective against all enemies, regardless of their MDEF.

title: Thief Hit Rate Rebalance
description: The thief and ninja's hit rate is increased from +2 per level to +4.

title: MDef Mode Rebalancing
description: Adjusts the Magic Defense gains for classes on level up.

title: Enable Procedural Floor Generation
description: Enables the generation of random floors for various dungeons.

title: Generated Waterfall Cave
description: Randomly generates the map for the Waterfall cave.

title: Generated Earth Cave B1
description: Randomly generates the map for the first level of Earth Cave.

title: Generated Earth Cave B2
description: Randomly generates the map for the second level of Earth Cave.

title: Shuffle the Four Original Fiend Fights
description: Shuffles which fiend is guarding which orb in the present day. For example, the fiend at the bottom of Earth Cave could be Kraken.

title: Use Older v2 Placement
description: Uses an older algorithm to place key items which favored placing the Ship and Canal in the inner sea, even if the Airship could be obtained early.

title: NPC Guillotine
description: Talking to certain NPCs removes them from the map when their dialog is dismissed. This can be used to make bats go away, for example.

title: Disable Tent/Cabin/House Saving on Overworld
description: When enabled, using a TENT, CABIN, or HOUSE will only restore HP/MP and not save the game.

title: Disable Inn Saving
description: When enabled, staying at an inn will only restore HP/MP, but not save the game.

title: Save Game When Game Over
description:
When enabled, if your party perishes, you will respawn with all of your progression (items acquired, levels gained, etc.) intact.
If you have the SHIP (but not the airship), you will respawn where you last docked; if you have the AIRSHIP, you will respawn at the airship and the ship will be waiting for you at Coneria; if you have neither, you will respawn where you last saved.

title: Dragon Warrior Mode
description: Always respawn at Coneria (the Ship and Airship will wait for you there if you have them). Gold is halved.

title: Shuffle Astos
description: Astos disguises himself as another NPC: Bahamut, Canoe Sage, CubeBot, Elf Doctor, Elf Prince, Fairy, King, Lefein, Matoya, Nerrick, Princess Sara, Sarda, Smith, Titan, Unne or the kindly old king from Northwest Castle.

title: Generate New Formations (Enemizer)
description: Generates entirely new formations of enemies.

title: Generate New Enemies (Enemizer)
description: Randomly generates all non-boss enemies.

title: Generate New Spellbook (Spellcrafter)
description: Randomly generates new white and black magic spell books, replacing all magic in the game.

title: Mix spellbooks (Spellcrafter)
description: Mixes the randomly generated spells, so spells that would typically be considered 'white' magic may be classed as 'black' magic and vice-versa.

title: Retain Old Permissions (Spellcrafter)
description: When enabled, Spellcrafter will not overwrite the game's original spell permissions, so Red Mages will learn the first and third slot in Level 1 White Magic, everything in the first four levels of black magic, etc.

title: Knight and Ninja Gain Charges In All Levels
description:
Sets the Knight and Ninja magic charge growth to give a charge in all levels whenever those classes gain a charge in any level, giving Knight and Ninja tier 4-8 charges.
This alleviates an issue with Keep Permissions where the Knight and Ninja could never cast spells they could learn, but is useless otherwise.

title: Buff the Pirates
description:
Increases the stats of Bikke's pirates considerably, roughly to the equivalent of a level 6 Fighter with a cheap but decent sword and iron armor, and increases the XP and gold yield from them by a factor of 20.
This is done before stat scaling, and also increases the level of script they can carry when generating balanced scripts (if Allow Unsafe Pirates is on).

title: Change Spell Caster Max MP
description:
Allows the control over the maximum spell charges per spell level. This does not change when they recieve new spell levels.
A value of less than 2 will not reduce the starting level 1 charges of red/white/black mages.

title: Set Max Knight Ninja MP
description: At the moment with the way the game is coded, knight's and ninja's max mp is determined together. This wont change when they get spells, it will still be at every odd level starting at 15.

title: Multi-instrumentalist Sara
description: Change Princess Sara's Lute to another instrument.

title: Hurray Dwarf's Fate
description: Choose if Hurray Dwarf is spared when NPC Guillotine is on or kill him.

title: Guaranteed Ruse Item
description: Turn the Power Staff into a RUSE casting item immune to Item Magic and Randomize Treasures that won't be placed in ToFR.

title: Remove Stun Touch from Randomize Status Attacks
description: Remove stun touch from possible status attacks when Randomize Enemy Status Attacks is enabled.

title: Characters gated by Fiends
description: A new character (from a random class) is behind each Fiend. When talked to, that character replaces the 4th slot party member.

title: Characters linked to Key NPCs
description:
A new character (from a random class) is linked to a key NPC. If that key NPC requirement is fulfilled, the linked character replaces the 4th slot party member.
Possible key NPCs: Princess Sara, Matoya, Bikke, King of the Northwest Castle, Elf Prince, Smith, Nerrick, Dr. Unne, Sarda, Canoe Sage, Fairy, Lefeinish Man.

title: Allow Duplicates
description: Not all 6 classes will be guaranteed.

title: Promoted Classes
description: Characters will be from promoted classes.

title: Remove Tail
description: Remove the Tail from the items pool, disallowing class change.

title: Earlier Ruby
description: Adjust the Ruby's placement to earlier in the seed to increase the likelihood that negotiating the Titan's Tunnel is required for progression.

title: Set Lock Hit Mode
description: Allows control over LOCK and LOK2 chance to hit. 107 is about 20% vs chaos. 160 is about 50% vs chaos. Autohit will always hit.
